channel.title: Music on clients
channel.description: how do i add music on my client and like have it play ?

item.title: Music on clients
item.dc:creator: @Project_Evolution Project Evolution
item.description:
@Project_Evolution wrote:

[quote=“ry60003333, post:3, topic:232245”][quote author=the reaper77 link=topic=305924.msg2450642#msg2450642 date=1221955452]
Post this in the moparscape client section. i’m sure you will receive better help there.
[/quote]
Thats for MoparScape client questions only. He is talking about his client. Don’t direct people to post in the wrong section.

I use the real music packet for RS music, and I made a custom packet to play music I have my client download in the background into the cache folder. It can player MIDIs and MP3s. It downloads in the background as I said so the user doesn’t have to wait at startup, and it gets the music out of a music list it redownloads on every startup.

So I am able to add or remove music without the user having to even redownload the client, the client automatically downloads the cache and the music, and I can make the server send packets to play any music I want. :)[/quote]
Lol, nice dude.

Read full topic

item.title: Music on clients
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“ry60003333, post:3, topic:232245”][quote author=the reaper77 link=topic=305924.msg2450642#msg2450642 date=1221955452]
Post this in the moparscape client section. i’m sure you will receive better help there.
[/quote]
Thats for MoparScape client questions only. He is talking about his client. Don’t direct people to post in the wrong section.

I use the real music packet for RS music, and I made a custom packet to play music I have my client download in the background into the cache folder. It can player MIDIs and MP3s. It downloads in the background as I said so the user doesn’t have to wait at startup, and it gets the music out of a music list it redownloads on every startup.

So I am able to add or remove music without the user having to even redownload the client, the client automatically downloads the cache and the music, and I can make the server send packets to play any music I want. :)[/quote]
Only one major flaw I saw in that - don’t redownload the list every time at start-up. Use an update server, and check if a change has been made. Other than that, holy fuck <333333

Read full topic

item.title: Music on clients
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

Thats for MoparScape client questions only. He is talking about his client. Don’t direct people to post in the wrong section.

I use the real music packet for RS music, and I made a custom packet to play music I have my client download in the background into the cache folder. It can player MIDIs and MP3s. It downloads in the background as I said so the user doesn’t have to wait at startup, and it gets the music out of a music list it redownloads on every startup.

So I am able to add or remove music without the user having to even redownload the client, the client automatically downloads the cache and the music, and I can make the server send packets to play any music I want.
